variant.question: When the accident or the serious incident has occurred in the territory of a non-Contracting State (to ICAO Convention) which does not intend to conduct an investigation in accordance with Annex 13:

options.text: All of the above.
The State of Registry should itself conduct an investigation with such information as is available.
When the location of the accident cannot definitely be established as being in the territory of any State, the State of Registry shall conduct investigation of the accident.
The State of Registry should attempt to conduct an investigation in cooperation with the State of Occurrence.

variant.question: An aircraft accident takes place in the sea, in the territory of State A. The aircraft is registered in State B. The conduct of the investigation is the responsibility of (1)___ and shall normally include, if possible, the determination of the causes and/or (2)___.

options.text: (1) State A; (2) contributing factors
(1) State A; (2) faults to apportion blame
(1) State B; (2) contributing factors
(1) State B; (2) faults to apportion blame

variant.question: The sole objective of the investigation of an accident or incident shall be the;

options.text: prevention of accidents or incidents.
prevention of accidents or incidents and to provide legal evidence for subsequent court cases.
prevention of accidents or incidents and to provide the manufacturer with investigation data for the improvement of the design.
prevention of accidents or incidents and to establish liability.

variant.question: An aircraft is flying over the threshold prior to touchdown when the pilots observe a vehicle crossing the runway and take immediate action to go around to avoid causing a collision between the aircraft and the vehicle. The pilots report this incident and an investigation takes place following the procedures set out in ICAO Annex 13. What is the sole purpose of this investigation?

options.text: To prevent such incidents from occurring again.
To apportion adequate blame, or liability, on the agency or personnel responsible for the incursion.
To ensure that factual data are collated and analysed for use in any subsequent judicial proceedings.
To ensure that the flight crew, air traffic control and any additional units or agencies followed the correct operating procedures.

variant.question: If an accident or incident occurs, to report it, you should follow:

options.text: ICAO Annex 13.
ICAO Doc 8 168.
regional agreements.
ICAO Doc 7 030.

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 13, a flight recorder is any type of recorder installed in the aircraft for the purpose of...

options.text: Complementing accident/incident investigation.
Allowing crews direct access to flight data.
Verifying infringements of applicable regulations.
Verifying insurance and liability issues.

variant.question: The accident investigation preliminary report shall be submitted to appropriate States and to the ICAO, in:

options.text: one of the working languages of ICAO.
any of the world's major languages.
the language of the investigating State.
English.

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 13, what mass does ICAO mean when referring to the maximum mass in an accident investigation?

options.text: Maximum certificated take-off mass
Maximum zero fuel mass
Maximum landing mass
Maximum block mass

variant.question: What is the objective of the investigation of an accident or incident, according to ICAO Annex 13 (Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation)?

options.text: To prevent accidents and incidents.
To determine the aircraft manufacturer`s liability.
To determine the operator`s liability.
To apportion blame for the subsequent legal proceedings.

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 13, what is the definition of the term accident?

options.text: A person is fatally or seriously injured, or the aircraft sustains damage or structural failure, or the aircraft is missing or is completely inaccessible.
A person receives minor injuries, or the aircraft sustains minor damage.
A person is fatally or seriously injured, or the aircraft sustains minor damage or structural failure.
An occurrence associated with the operation of an aircraft which affects or could affect the safety of operation.

variant.question: To what geographical area(s) does ICAO Annex 13 Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation apply?

options.text: All geographical areas.
The territory of the Contracting States.
The territory of the Contracting States and the high seas.
All geographical areas, excluding the high seas.
